match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: How did Mumbai Indians form such a solid team? Former Proteas Performance Analyst, Prasanna Agoram - fondly known as PDogg - helps us understand their success mantra through this exclusive on Cricbuzz Plus.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Mumbai Indians (Playing XI): Rohit Sharma(c), Chris Lynn, Suryakumar Yadav, Ishan Kishan(w), Hardik Pandya, Kieron Pollard, Krunal Pandya, Rahul Chahar, Marco Jansen, Trent Boult, Jasprit Bumrah

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Royal Challengers Bangalore (Playing XI): Virat Kohli(c), Rajat Patidar, AB de Villiers(w), Glenn Maxwell, Daniel Christian, Washington Sundar, Kyle Jamieson, Harshal Patel, Mohammed Siraj, Shahbaz Ahmed, Yuzvendra Chahal

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Rohit: Would've fielded first as well. But as a team we've batted well over the years. Nothing different for us. Bat well in the powerplay and set the game up for the big hitters. The entire square has been changed. Recently played a couple of Tests. Need to do what we do as a team, put our best foot forward. For us it's a fresh year, don't need to look at what's happened in the past. Fresh year, new faces as well. Important for us to start well which we haven;t done in this tournament. Last game we played was a final in Dubai. Got only two changes from that lineup. Quinny is in quarantine, so he isn't available. Lynn will make debut. And we have a six foot eight inch South African, Marco Jensen.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Kohli: It's unbelievable, bit of a mini break helped me I guess to win a toss. Going to bowl first. They're a side who likes chasing. Good chance for us to get onto the park and create some intensity. With the balance we have this year we can do both, but have to understand who you're playing against. We understand with the depth they have they have never out of the game. Bowling first was a no-brainer for us. Every year IPL has a different energy, a different vibe. It's high intensity. Playing for the same franchise has been an honour for me. Loyalty is a big thing for me. Dubai was great as well but this just feels like home. Great feeling to be playing in our stadiums and for people to watch in our prime times. Three guys making their debut: Maxwell, Jamieson, Christian is back after eight years for the same franchise. Rajat Patidar makes his debut as well. Padikkal has been recommended rest.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Royal Challengers Bangalore have won the toss and have opted to field

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: "When I look at this ground, feels deceptively small but it isn't. Test match pitch was totally different. This one looks a lot better. New ball will come on to the bat nicely, but the problem will arrive once the ball gets old. Once the spinners come into play, there will be a lot of deviation," reckons L Sivaramakrishnan along with Danny Morrison in the pitch report.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: 6.40pm local: For those asking, looks like de Kock won't be part of the team today for MI. In fact, Chris Lynn has been handed his cap by Rohit Sharma. There's also a surpise debut lined up for Marco Jansen, a 20-year old left-arm pacer from South Africa.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: 6.30pm local: RCB played the season opener at Chepauk in 2019, and were bowled out for a shocking 70 runs. The pitch this time though is expected to be more sporting. In general, however, spinners should be a much happier bunch with the tournament coming back to India. It will be interesting to see how Mumbai, traditionally a pace-heavy outfit, cope with it, given their pacers won't have the comforts of the Wankhede to rely on either.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: 6.15pm local: New picks, record buys, neutral venues, new captains - all of this will be part of the flavour of this year's IPL. But will this new flavour also entail Mumbai Indians breaking the trend of losing season openers? They're up against the Royal Challengers Bangalore today, a team they've historically done very well against. "The journey of Mumbai Indians though has come to a point where there are more ghosts to fear in the Indian Premier League opener than in the final. Several of their players have laughed off the thought of what ails them in the first stop and suggest that the winless run since 2012 is beyond their understanding," Aayush Puthran writes in the preview below.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: 5.45pm IST: There's a lot riding on this tournament for the players as they gear up for the T20 World Cup later this year. A final chance to really smash the door down for those on the outside: the likes of Prithvi Shaw, R Ashwin, Sanju Samson among others. Players not in form, like KL Rahul, will be desperate to regain it. And the focus will be to stay away from injuries as well. What're your predictions for the player to watch out for this time around. Go ahead, tell us in the comments that've now been enabled.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: But in the times we're living in, the IPL does come as a much-needed respite for many. TV figures for the 2020 edition were through the roof, with nearly half of India's audience tuning into the competition. Fingers crossed this season runs as smoothly as that one did, although it's going to be a hell of a challenge over the next couple of months. Anyway, thanks for joining us today. This is Sagar Chawla welcoming you to our live coverage as we get ready for everything that the cricket has to offer.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: 5.30pm IST: Hello to everyone joining in early for a whole new season of the IPL. Only around five months since the night when Mumbai Indians lifted their .. fifth, was it? .. trophy, the tournament is back again, raising anticipation levels and scoffing at the very idea of viewer fatigue. And it's back home too as it returns from the UAE where it had been moved last year due to the pandemic. The threat of Covid-19 has gone nowhere though. It has only intensified in the form of a second wave that's hit India hard these last few weeks. Concerns have been growing along with the tally of positive cases in and around the IPL; spectators, who briefly made a return, are once again banned from stadiums; the tournament itself will follow a caravan format across six cities; and, of course, there are the intricately layered bio-bubbles that franchises have to contend with.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary:
Preview by Aayush Puthran

Rohit Sharma vs Virat Kohli - is as much a Friday blockbuster can offer in the times of lockdowns and OTTs.

Beyond the marketing gimmicks and fan-club pleasing scheduling though, comes a highly valued cricket match between two teams - one that aims to strengthen its legacy and the other that wishes to halt it.

The journey of Mumbai Indians though has come to a point where there are more ghosts to fear in the Indian Premier League opener than in the final. Several of their players have laughed off the thought of what ails them in the first stop and suggest that the winless run since 2012 is beyond their understanding. What Mumbai Indians would be out to fix in the tournament opener, is what Royal Challengers Bangalore would be doing with respect to their fortunes in the competition: try to figure out what is going wrong!

While the defending champions have retained their core unit, RCB spent big bucks at the 2021 auction to acquire the services of Glenn Maxwell and Kyle Jamieson to strengthen them further. Yet, much like most of the seasons, where they seemed to have assembled a strong squad, the winning formula is yet to be discovered.

Mumbai Indians’ second-best win percentage is against RCB (among all teams against whom they have played more than six matches), and yet despite their dominance, Virat Kohli’s side managed to run them close twice last year and even become one of only three teams to beat MI’s full-strength XI.

A good reason for their dominance has come at the back of being able to control Kohli in recent years. The RCB skipper hasn’t managed to break free easily against the five-time champions and the challenge will get stiffer in Chennai, where his scoring rate has only been 111.49. AB de Villiers though enjoys his time in Chepauk, where he has scored 228 runs at a strike rate of 152. What’s to be expected out of their new recruit Maxwell remains unknown, not just for his unpredictability but also because he is yet to play at the venue.

Despite MI’s recent dominance in Chennai, their top-order hasn’t enjoyed a good run either. They can, however, rely more on their least appreciated front - the spin department. Krunal Pandya and Rahul Chahar have conceded runs at marginally over 4 every six balls. But much like RCB’s quest to find answers, MI too have reasons to wonder: in the vast pool of talent and ideas, is there enough to break the first-match jinx?

What to expect: Even as Chennai has traditionally played slow and helped the spinners, the tournament opener is the flattest pitch that is likely to be on offer this season. However, with neither team boasting of a top-class spin attack, mid-range scores could be on the cards.

When: Friday, April 9, 2021, 7:30 PM IST

Where: Mumbai Indians vs Royal Challengers Bangalore, Chennai

Team News:

Mumbai Indians: Although Quinton de Kock has taken a bubble to bubble transfer from South Africa, MI have stated on their website that a new opening pair will feature on Friday. Mumbai Indians could be tempted to break away from their set format and play an additional spinner, especially given Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers’ ailings against leggies.

Probable XI: Ishan Kishan (wk), Rohit Sharma, Suryakumar Yadav, Saurabh Tiwary, Hardik Pandya, Kieron Pollard, Krunal Pandya, Piyush Chawla/Jayant Yadav, Rahul Chahar, Trent Boult, Jasprit Bumrah

Royal Challengers Bangalore: Devdutt Padikkal has resumed training and could be available for the opening match. Kane Richardson and Adam Zampa are unlikely to be available for selection. The number five slot could be up for grabs for one of the three uncapped Indian players. Shahbaz Ahmed could also be in contention.

B6$ Devdutt Padikkal, Virat Kohli (c), Glenn Maxwell, AB de Villiers, Mohammad Azharuddin/Rajat Patidar, Daniel Christian, Washington Sundar, Kyle Jamieson, Navdeep Saini, Mohammad Siraj, Yuzvendra Chahal.

Did you know?

Royal Challengers Bangalore’s 37.04 percent success rate against Mumbai Indians is the second worst for them against any team. The worst is against Chennai Super Kings (34.62)

Barring Yuzvendra Chahal, none of the RCB spinners have played an IPL game in Chennai. The leggie's economy rate of 5.25, fairly higher than Mumbai’s spin duo of Krunal (4.00) and Chahar (4.38).

Mumbai Indians’ top order has a low scoring rate in Chennai. Ishan Kishan (90.32), Rohit Sharma (119.69) and Suryakumar Yadav (108.75) would look to better on that pace.

What they said:


"Having done well last year in such a competitive scenario and space, we're very confident that as a side, with a stronger squad this time around, we'll have another great season. Just playing in set venues with four teams, I think that's going to nullify all the home advantage that every team used to have." - Virat Kohli, RCB skipper.

ball_commentary: Welcome back! Virat Kohli is back at the top for RCB and it's gonna be Washington Sundar who will open alongside him. Trent Boult to kickstart proceedings with the ball. Two slips in place. Off we go...

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Harshal: Ball started tailing a bit when I came into bowl the 16th over, that was my cue. And I executed brilliantly. You can't look at the opposition all the time. All you need to focus on at the top of your mark is your execution and planning and that's what I did. It was very clear from the beginning I was going to bowl two overs at the death but today I bowled three. Feels great. This is my first five-wicket haul in all the T20s I've played. Coming against MI it feels special. It's a decent batting surface. Just the dimensions allow you to take pace off. Also the bounce isn't as good as it usually is. It's probably keeping low. But I don't think it's a two paced wicket.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: 21:21 Local Time, 15:51 GMT, 21:21 IST: Stunning last over from Harshal Patel. Three wickets and just one run. What a squeeze this is from RCB. MI were 86/1 in 10 overs and SKY was looking dangerous. RCB didn't have renowned names for the death overs, but they have kept Rohit and Co. to under 160 and Kohli is extremely happy. 73/8 in the last 10 overs against a side like MI is not a joke. Credit to Kohli for his smart captaincy. Got Jamieson back on to get Surya, introduced Sundar to get Lynn. Siraj bowled a very good wicketless spell. And then Harshal Patel stole the show. Almost got a hat-trick as he recorded his best IPL figures. Kohli got hit under his right eye missing a catch. It turned red and he walked off the field after the innings with an icepack. RCB will back themselves to chase this down. MI will pray for the dew to be absent today. Chase coming up shortly.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Harshal Patel to Bumrah, out Rahul Chahar Run Out!! 1 run completed. Bumrah drives off the front foot to long-on, Chahar races back to see if can steal a run, but Bumrah wasn't keen. Both batsmen at one end. AB gently checks the bails off after collecting the throw. Rahul Chahar run out (Kohli/de Villiers) 0(0)

All those worried about RCB's death bowling will be happy to see this. Jansen obviously not well equipped to dig this out, loses the off stick and walks back. Marco Jansen b Harshal Patel 0(2)

Bat turns on impact and ball goes straight to deep backward square leg to make it the best bowling figures for Harshal Patel in IPL. He's on a hat-trick too. Kohli moved to the left, tried to go reverse cup style and spilled the catch

It's a very interesting middle phase that happened. Runs, smart moves and wickets. 170 is a very good total on this up and down pitch. Can RCB close out the overs well?

Pandya played for normal pace and fell over slightly trying the flick, the ball came slow and the impact was in line with leg stump. Hardik was across the stumps to make like easy for umpire Nitin Menon, but you don't need external help if you are Nitin Menon. Been top class with his umpiring. Hardik Pandya lbw b Harshal Patel 13(10) [4s-2]

ball_commentary: Christian to Ishan Kishan, 2 runs, short slower delivery, Kishan helps it away to deep mid-wicket, big enough gap for two

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, short and slow, Pandya waits to slap it hard to long-on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Hardik Pandya, no run, pace off, back of a length, Pandya pushes to point

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Hardik Pandya, FOUR, wo wo! Careful, Dan! Forget the boundary, Christian had to protect his head. Oh he actually didn't try to save his face, went for the catch. Pandya smashes this overpitched freebie, the ball escaped Christian's hands as he went reverse cup. Thankfully no damage done

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Hardik Pandya, no run, short of length and rushing Pandya on the cross-batted swipe, hit on the thigh pad

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Daniel Christian [1.0-0-13-0] is back into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: MI are already going at a good rate on this pitch. So Pandya happy to get his eye in. We all know how he can demolish spinners

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, flighted delivery on the leg stump, Pandya defends and plays it to mid-on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, swept away through backward square leg

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Ishan Kishan, FOUR, and he extends his arms further. Threatens to advance again, so Chahal bowls way outside off stump, Kishan stretches fully and guides late, splits backward point and short third man to perfection

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Ishan Kishan, SIX, a delight to watch clean-hitters in this format. Chahal trying to push this wide on seeing Kishan advance, but Kishan ushed his reach to loft this handsomely into the black sightscreen

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Hardik Pandya, 1 run, risky! But he escapes. Pandya blocked this off the front foot to the right of the bowler, Chahal attacked with the slide and fired the throw but it was wide. Flings his left elbow in mild pain as he landed badly. Is fine to carry on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Yuzvendra Chahal [3.0-0-26-0] is back into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Washington Sundar to Ishan Kishan, no run, tries to flick, wears it on the pad, going down

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Hardik Pandya, right handed bat, comes to the crease

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Washington Sundar to Chris Lynn, out Caught&Bowled!! Another master move by Kohli! He's been smart with his bowling changes and there's no set pattern for the opponents to expect. Washi gets turns from his home pitch and Lynn miscued the slog completely. looked like it hit him on the outside half and sligjtly high too. Washi knew there was no mid-on or mid-wicket. so raced back from his bowling crease, judged it really well and took it over his shoulders. A good debut for Lynn. Had to dig deep after running the captain out. Chris Lynn c and b Washington Sundar 49(35) [4s-4 6s-3]

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Washington Sundar to Chris Lynn, THATS OUT!! Caught&Bowled!!

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Washington Sundar to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slogged across the linne to deep square leg

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Washington Sundar to Chris Lynn, FOUR, catch is the cry but you had to be Matt Hayden to be placed very straight at mid-on by Dhoni. Flatter delivery slightly turning, Lynn bunts it hard, hits it over the non-striker and long-on had no chance

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Sundar in the second half of the innings! Do they have a different role for him? Interesting...

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Washington Sundar to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Kishan pushes past Washi's dive towards long-on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Washington Sundar, right-arm off break, comes into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, smarly opens the face of the bat and guides late to third man, used all the pace on offer from Siraj. Cut off at third man though

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Chris Lynn, 1 run, in the airrrr and just short of Jamieson. If Jamieson can't get there, no one in this RCB line-up can. Pace off and into the pitch again, good variation from Siraj, Lynn toe-ends the slap towards mid-off, who runs and dives. Doesn't get there

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Chris Lynn, no run, oh beat him for pace! An Indian pacer beats a bloke who plays at the Gabba for pace on a sluggish pitch! Wow! Fullish and outside off stump, Lynn was late in coming forward, lucky didn't edge this to ABdV

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Ishan Kishan, 1 run, tucked through backward square leg as Siraj rushes Kishan with a short of length delivery

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Ishan Kishan, no run, oh Kishan looks to defend and gets hit high on the bat. This is playing slightly up and down, so won't be easy to hit straightaway unless dew sets in

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Chris Lynn, 1 run, short of length delivery on the off stump, Lynn pushes it along the ground for a run

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Mohammed Siraj [2.0-0-11-0] is back into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Ishan Kishan, left handed bat, comes to the crease

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Suryakumar Yadav, out Caught by de Villiers!! Wow! He's got him and what a move by Kohli! Two overs left off Jamieson but he was smart to use one of them now. If the surface is slow, pace off and into the wicket works. Jamieson gets a bit of bounce too, SKY had to delay the upper cut and that put his balance off a wee bit, which is why he outside-edged this to the keeper. Delight for Kohli and RCB. The set and ominous looking Surya walks back. Jamieson opens his wickets column in the IPL. Suryakumar Yadav c de Villiers b Jamieson 31(23) [4s-4 6s-1]

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Suryakumar Yadav, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, good comeback from Jamieson. Bowls back of a length and outside off stump, tough length to hit on sluggish surfaces. SKY slashes and misses

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Suryakumar Yadav, SIX, that's it! That the zone. Jamieson feeding a leg stump ball on length, SKY loves to use his wrists, flicks it aerial and doesn't mind the fielder in the deep. Clears quite comfortably

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, oh what happened there? SKY playing too far across the line, wanted to send this hack through square leg than mid-wicket, misses and the ball brushes the thigh pad en route to ABdV

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Chris Lynn, 1 run, oh went for the big slog across the line but Jamieson took pace off to catch the inside edge, ball rolls along the groung through backward square leg

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, driven along the ground to long-on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, leading edge as Lynn tries to work against the turn. It loops up and falls short of backward point. Chahal extracts quite a bit of turn as Lynn looks to whip a ball from outside off

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, back of a length on off, flat through the air, Lynn blocks from the crease

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, cuts it from close to off stump wide of point

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, goes for the sweep again, with the ball this time deflecting fine off the pad past leg stump as Chahal fires it through. The umpire gives it runs, maybe an edge was involved too

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, tries sweeping off leg stump but gets it on the glove as the ball stops on him

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Yuzvendra Chahal [2.0-0-23-0] is back into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Time out! If you were worried Rohit's run out was going to weigh on Lynn, that fear has been bashed out pretty quick. The pitch didn't initially look like it had a run-fest in it, but Lynn and now Suryakumar have got the boundaries flowing. Dangerous times for RCB.

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Chris Lynn, FOUR, back of a length delivery outside off, slapped hard through extra cover. Sundar slides across at the boundary looking to flick it in. But his foot is in contact with the cushion as he does so

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Chris Lynn, wide, goes for a wide yorker but this is well beyond the marker

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Chris Lynn, 2 runs, gosh how hard has he hit this. Back of a length outside off, there's width for Lynn who flat-bats it down the ground. Jamieson does really well at long-off to his right

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, clipped through to deep midwicket

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, Suryakumar doing Suryakumar things. Manufactures a late cut out of nowhere. Back of a length delivery close to off, he has the field in mind with third man in the ring, and he has the talent to pull it off despite the lack of room

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Christian to Chris Lynn, 1 run, advances down to find the length being shortened, swats it away to deep midwicket

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Daniel Christian, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Harshal Patel to Chris Lynn, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Lynn punches to deep point

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Harshal Patel to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, Harshal takes pace off and is driven through to long-on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Harshal Patel to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, boundaries flowing for MI. Barely short of length, but Suryakumar gets in such a fine position that he still manages to pull it away crisply through midwicket. Probably should've been cut off by long-on running across

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Harshal Patel to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, looks to driven on the up but this cross-seam delivery stops on him. Suryakumar chips it up towards mid-off. Doesn't carry

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Harshal Patel to Chris Lynn, 1 run, clipped away through square leg

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Harshal Patel to Chris Lynn, SIX, Lynn has swallowed this free hit whole. Short of length, absolutely pounds the pull over cow corner

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Harshal Patel to Suryakumar Yadav, no ball, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Suryakumar punches it through to deep cover. The hooter goes off at the stadium, Harshal has overstepped

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Shahbaz Ahmed to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, driven to long-on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Shahbaz Ahmed to Chris Lynn, SIX, this is incredible power on show. Not quite on the Lynnsanity spectrum, but getting there. Back of a length, fired in on leg stump, Lynn just stands in the crease and whacks it over long-on. Not many could've done that

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Shahbaz Ahmed to Chris Lynn, FOUR, slapped away through extra cover. Only slightly short, turnng away from off stump. Lynn backs away to make room and belts it

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Shahbaz Ahmed to Suryakumar Yadav, 1 run, quite full at the stumps, driven to long-off

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Shahbaz Ahmed to Chris Lynn, 1 run, flat and pushed through, back of a length around off from round the wicket, Lynn punches down to long-off

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Shahbaz Ahmed, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, and finishes the powerplay with a boundary. The move to get Chahal in early hasn't worked for RCB as MI have injected momentum into their innings by taking him for runs. Dragged down short outside off, Suryakumar cuts it through the gap in the off-side ring

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, length ball drifting in on leg, quicker through the air, Suryakumar gets his front leg out and defends

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, whips the googly uppishly through midwicket

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, darted in flat, back of a length just outside off, Lynn cuts but can't beat a diving backward point

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, SIX, seems to have got hold of it. Just about. Dances down to get close to the pitch and swings down the ground. Bat face slightly turns but he's got enough meat to clear long-on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, full ball at the stumps, defended into the on-side

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field

ball_commentary: Jamieson to Suryakumar Yadav, no run, defended down the wicket

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: STAT: Rohit Sharma has been involved in most runouts in IPL - 36 (11 times himself out, 25 times partners out)

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Suryakumar Yadav, FOUR, this bloke continues to find timing straightaway, slow pitch or whatever. Poor delivery though. Back of a length on the pads, clipped away to the square leg boundary

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Kyle Jamieson [1.0-0-1-0] is back into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Suryakumar Yadav, right handed bat, comes to the crease

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, out Rohit Run Out!! A mix-up out there, and Rohit's gone! Oh dear. He was really keen for the single, but from halfway down Lynn sends him back. It's too late. Slightly short ball just outside off, Lynn mistimes the cut in between two fielders at cover and cover-point. He takes a couple of steps initially, which really sets Rohit off. But then Lynn backs out. And with Kohli swooping onto the ball, there's no getting back. Massive blow. Will it weigh on Lynn now? Rohit run out (Kohli/Chahal) 19(15) [4s-1 6s-1]

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, THATS OUT!! Run Out!!

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Rohit, 1 run, nudged into the on-side

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Rohit, SIX, oh this is delightful from Rohit. Flighted up from Chahal, and the footwork from the MI captain to get to the ball is what makes this shot. Dances down, just chips it through the line over mid-on and the timing is such that it's gone all the way

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, 1 run, slow on middle, the leg-break this time and Lynn punches to long-off

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, FOUR, doesn't pick the googly, but the inside edge saves him. Length ball turning in from off, Lynn clears the front leg to flat-bat it through the covers expecting it to go away. Eventually the ball takes a thick inside edge past leg stump

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal to Chris Lynn, no run, pushes it through flat on middle stump. It's a length ball that slides through and Lynn watches it cautiously in defence

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Yuzvendra Chahal, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Chahal in early. Slip in place

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, 2 runs, back of a length on middle and leg, Rohit clips it through midwicket for two

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, FOUR, finally the first boundary. Goes through with the lofted drive off a length ball and just gets it over mid-off. Has managed to clear Jamieson there

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, no run, full ball slanting in on leg, Rohit tries clipping it away but it nips in off the seam and hits the front pad. Would've missed leg stump

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, no run, they're itching to break loose. But it's not coming off. Short of length, stays low and goes below Rohit's attempted pull. Goes on the bounce to the keeper diving across

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, no run, tries driving a length ball on the up but mistimes it to mid-on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, no run, back of a length around off, ball stops on Rohit as he looks to punch through the off-side. Goes off the inside half to midwicket. Doesn't look like a high-scoring game is on the cards today

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Chris Lynn, no run, Lynn tries to break the shackles with a charge down the pitch, and is lucky he hasn't chopped it back onto his stumps. Short of length, Lynn slashes hard after making room but gets a thick bottom edge past off stump

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Chris Lynn, no run, back of a length, Lynn blocks it from the crease

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Chris Lynn, no run, an edge that falls short of first slip. Clearly the lack of pace in the pitch on display here. Lynn went hard on the drive as Jamieson pitched it up, genuine edge, but on the bounce to the fielder diving to his left

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Chris Lynn, no run, pitched up around off, Lynn drives to mid-off. The ball doesn't seem to be coming on all that well, at least that's the early impression

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Chris Lynn, no run, back of a length on leg, Lynn is struck on the thigh pad looking to pull it away

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: STAT: MI last five games at Chepauk: W W W W W, RCB last five games at Chepauk: L L L L L

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Jamieson to Rohit, 1 run, Jamieson introduces himself to the IPL with an in-ducker. Really full, bending in on middle, Rohit digs it out wide of mid-on

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Kyle Jamieson, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, 1 run, back of a length delivery on off, Rohit tucks it through to deep square leg where a fielder was brought in at some point during the over

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, no run, short of length delivery on off, Rohit is right behind the line in defence

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, 2 runs, short of length around the hip, Rohit whips it wide of fine leg, gets back for two

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, no run, indications of the pace of this surface, and the bounce. Back of a length, probably wasn't there to pull in any case. Rohit goes for it but the ball sneaks under him and strikes him on the thigh

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, no run, full ball on middle, defended watchfully down the pitch

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Siraj to Rohit, 2 runs, straightaway into the pads. Siraj pitches it up but doesn't find much swing, leaning into middle and leg stumps and is clipped away for a couple through square leg. Rohit's away

match_toss: Royal Challengers Bangalore, who chose to field
ball_commentary: Rohit and Chris Lynn are at the crease. Rohit is on strike. Siraj will open the attack
